TF051096-WBGBK-PUBLIC FINANCE MANAGEMENT
            REFORM STRUCTURAL ADJUSTMENT GRANT,TF053218-WEST BANK AND GAZA BUDGET FACILITY

abstracts.cdata!:
The Public Sector Financial Management
            Reform Project for West Bank and Gaza had the following
            ratings: the outcome was satisfactory, the sustainability
            was likely, the institutional development impact was modest,
            and the Bank and borrower performance were both
            satisfactory. The lessons learned indicate that support of
            an already ongoing reform process provides legitimacy and
            increases commitment to project development objectives,
            which facilitates implementation. The Reform Fund enables
            the Bank to accompany the Palestinian Autorities PA's
            reform program beyond the life of the adjustment operation.
            The Bank's AAA program played a key part in helping the
            PA prepare and internalize the necessary reforms. The
            adjustment operation, and the accompanying Reform Fund are
            based on a common performance assessment framework and a
            joint review process, which harmonize general budget support
            of nine donors. While the overall reform program is quite
            ambitious, the Bank kept individual benchmarks simple and
            realistic. Benchmarks related to the security services have
            arguably been the most difficult to implement.
